content.description: The farthest right bolted line on the first pillar, Voodoo Doll is a pretty solid 5.7 and either the most difficult or second most difficult line on the pillar depending on your style.
Mostly natural rock holds for 15 ft. First solid protection is BD 0.5 cam in vertical slot about 15ft off the ground. More vertical and horizontal slots to the anchors.
content.protection: tricams/micro cams up to BD #0.75. Ring anchors.
content.location: The only route on the narrow south east face of the first pillar.

content.description: The middle clip line of the three on the front face of the first pillar. The route is full of good crimps, deep finger cracks, and  interesting side pull opportunities and a little more challenge than the other routes on this face. The route may seem more intimidating and bare than its neighbors to either side but the moves are easier than they look. The route has a balancy section from above first clip to clipping second that may be a little uncomfortable for brand new leaders. The clips are close together and the belay area below is pretty good aside from some broken glass left by hikers.
content.protection: This route now has four bolts plus two anchors at the top.

content.description: Climb to the right of the Bolts to Heaven bolt line.
Follows the corner/far right face to a two bolt anchor.
content.location: Around the corner from Pro For It.

content.description: Climb the center of the face to a two bolt anchor.
Climbs the center of the narrow face to a two bolt anchor that is on the top block. Extending a master point over the edge is advised. Typical Manchester Wall movement and style.
content.location: Around the corner and to climber's left of Bolts from Heaven.

content.description: Grid bolted route great for teaching neophyte leaders.  Low in the grade, high in protection.  Follow the arête at 5.5 or move onto just the face for a slightly more difficult path.
content.protection: Six bolts plus two anchors at the top

content.description: First pillar seperate from the main wall. Popular, fun moderates, most notably the aretes which are great for beginners and some ok trad leads. As with all the pillars, the toughest routes tend to be in the center of the faces, where you can't lean over and grab the edge of the pillar itself.
